column4: when he was twenty-one years of age
column5: he came into the possession of a large fortune. He married
column6: and thought that he had so much money that he could never spend it all.But
column7: before he was fifty years of age
column8: the whole of his large possessions had melted away. Some of his stately houses had been burned down; and the insurance-offices had failed. Some men he had trusted had proved dishonest; and many schemes that he had entered upon had turned out badly.At the age of forty-six
column9: Rudolf Reinhold took up the business of a carpenter
column10: which he had learned between the ages of fourteen and eighteen. He soon became skillful
column11: and turned his attention to building houses in the city of Berlin. So successful was he
column12: that in ten years he was once more a rich man.
